verses.text: How lonely sits the cityThat was full of people!How like a widow is she,Who was great among the nations!The princess among the provincesHas become a slave!
She weeps bitterly in the night,Her tears are on her cheeks;Among all her loversShe has none to comfort her.All her friends have dealt treacherously with her;They have become her enemies.
parts: She weeps bitterly in the night,
All her friends have dealt treacherously with her;

verses.text: Judah has gone into captivity,Under affliction and hard servitude;She dwells among the nations,She finds no rest;All her persecutors overtake her in dire straits.
parts: All her persecutors overtake her in dire straits.

verses.text: The roads to Zion mournBecause no one comes to the set feasts.All her gates are desolate;Her priests sigh,Her virgins are afflicted,And she is in bitterness.
parts: Because no one comes to the

verses.text: Her adversaries have become the master,Her enemies prosper;For the  has afflicted herBecause of the multitude of her transgressions.Her children have gone into captivity before the enemy.
parts: Because of the multitude of her transgressions.
Her children have gone into captivity before the enemy.

verses.text: And from the daughter of ZionAll her splendor has departed.Her princes have become like deerThat find no pasture,That flee without strengthBefore the pursuer.
parts: And from the daughter of Zion
Her princes have become like deer

verses.text: In the days of her affliction and roaming,Jerusalem remembers all her pleasant thingsThat she had in the days of old.When her people fell into the hand of the enemy,With no one to help her,The adversaries saw herAnd mocked at her downfall.
parts: In the days of her affliction and roaming,
Jerusalem remembers all her pleasant things
That she had in the days of old.
When her people fell into the hand of the enemy,
With no one to help her,

verses.text: Jerusalem has sinned gravely,Therefore she has become vile.All who honored her despise herBecause they have seen her nakedness;Yes, she sighs and turns away.
parts: All who honored her despise her
Because they have seen her nakedness;
Yes, she sighs and turns away.

verses.text: Her uncleanness is in her skirts;She did not consider her destiny;Therefore her collapse was awesome;She had no comforter.“O , behold my affliction,For the enemy is exalted!”
parts: She did not consider her destiny;

verses.text: The adversary has spread his handOver all her pleasant things;For she has seen the nations enter her sanctuary,Those whom You commandedNot to enter Your assembly.
parts: The adversary has spread his hand
For she has seen the nations enter her

verses.text: All her people sigh,They seek bread;They have given their valuables for food to restore life.“See, O , and consider,For I am scorned.”
parts: valuables for food to restore life.

verses.text: “Is it nothing to you, all you who pass by?Behold and seeIf there is any sorrow like my sorrow,Which has been brought on me,Which the  has inflictedIn the day of His fierce anger.
parts: nothing to you, all you who
If there is any sorrow like my sorrow,
Which has been brought on me,
In the day of His fierce anger.

verses.text: “From above He has sent fire into my bones,And it overpowered them;He has spread a net for my feetAnd turned me back;He has made me desolateAnd faint all the day.
parts: “From above He has sent fire into my bones,
He has spread a net for my feet

verses.text: “The yoke of my transgressions was bound;They were woven together by His hands,And thrust upon my neck.He made my strength fail;The Lord delivered me into the hands of those whom I am not able to withstand.
parts: They were woven together by His hands,
The Lord delivered me into the hands of
I am not able to withstand.

verses.text: “The Lord has trampled underfoot all my mighty men in my midst;He has called an assembly against meTo crush my young men;The Lord trampled as in a winepressThe virgin daughter of Judah.
parts: “The Lord has trampled underfoot all my mighty
He has called an assembly against me

verses.text: “For these things I weep;My eye, my eye overflows with water;Because the comforter, who should restore my life,Is far from me.My children are desolateBecause the enemy prevailed.”
parts: My eye, my eye overflows with water;
Because the comforter, who should restore my life,

verses.text: Zion spreads out her hands,But no one comforts her;The  has commanded concerning JacobThat those around him become his adversaries;Jerusalem has become an unclean thing among them.
parts: Jerusalem has become an unclean thing among them.

verses.text: “The  is righteous,For I rebelled against His commandment.Hear now, all peoples,And behold my sorrow;My virgins and my young menHave gone into captivity.
parts: My virgins and my young men

verses.text: “I called for my lovers,But they deceived me;My priests and my eldersBreathed their last in the city,While they sought foodTo restore their life.
parts: Breathed their last in the city,

verses.text: “See, O , that I am in distress;My soul is troubled;My heart is overturned within me,For I have been very rebellious.Outside the sword bereaves,At home it is like death.
parts: My heart is overturned within me,
For I have been very rebellious.

verses.text: “They have heard that I sigh,But no one comforts me.All my enemies have heard of my trouble;They are glad that You have done it.Bring on the day You have announced,That they may become like me.
parts: All my enemies have heard of my trouble;
They are glad that You have done
Bring on the day You have
That they may become like me.

verses.text: “Let all their wickedness come before You,And do to them as You have done to meFor all my transgressions;For my sighs are many,And my heart is faint.”
parts: “Let all their wickedness come before You,
And do to them as You have done to me

verses.text: How the Lord has covered the daughter of ZionWith a cloud in His anger!He cast down from heaven to the earthThe beauty of Israel,And did not remember His footstoolIn the day of His anger.
parts: How the Lord has covered the daughter of Zion
With a cloud in His anger!
He cast down from heaven to the earth
And did not remember His footstool
In the day of His anger.

verses.text: The Lord has swallowed up and has not pitiedAll the dwelling places of Jacob.He has thrown down in His wrathThe strongholds of the daughter of Judah;He has brought them down to the ground;He has profaned the kingdom and its princes.
parts: The Lord has swallowed up and has not pitied
All the dwelling places of Jacob.
He has thrown down in His wrath
The strongholds of the daughter of Judah;
He has profaned the kingdom and its princes.

verses.text: He has cut off in fierce angerEvery horn of Israel;He has drawn back His right handFrom before the enemy.He has blazed against Jacob like a flaming fireDevouring all around.
parts: He has cut off in fierce anger
He has drawn back His right hand
He has blazed against Jacob like a flaming fire

verses.text: Standing like an enemy, He has bent His bow;With His right hand, like an adversary,He has slain all who were pleasing to His eye;On the tent of the daughter of Zion,He has poured out His fury like fire.
parts: Standing like an enemy, He has bent His bow;
With His right hand, like an adversary,
On the tent of the daughter of Zion,
He has poured out His fury like fire.

verses.text: The Lord was like an enemy.He has swallowed up Israel,He has swallowed up all her palaces;He has destroyed her strongholds,And has increased mourning and lamentationIn the daughter of Judah.
parts: The Lord was like an enemy.
He has swallowed up all her palaces;
And has increased mourning and lamentation

verses.text: He has done violence to His tabernacle,As if it were a garden;He has destroyed His place of assembly;The  has causedThe appointed feasts and Sabbaths to be forgotten in Zion.In His burning indignation He has spurned the king and the priest.
parts: He has done violence to His
He has destroyed His place of assembly;
The appointed feasts and Sabbaths to be forgotten in Zion.

verses.text: The Lord has spurned His altar,He has abandoned His sanctuary;He has given up the walls of her palacesInto the hand of the enemy.They have made a noise in the house of the As on the day of a set feast.

given up the walls of her palaces
Into the hand of the enemy.

He has stretched out a line;

Therefore He has caused the rampart and wall to lament;

verses.text: Her gates have sunk into the ground;He has destroyed and broken her bars.Her king and her princes are among the nations;The Law is no more,And her prophets find no vision from the .

He has destroyed and broken her bars.

verses.text: The elders of the daughter of ZionSit on the ground and keep silence;They throw dust on their headsAnd gird themselves with sackcloth.The virgins of JerusalemBow their heads to the ground.
parts: The elders of the daughter of Zion
They throw dust on their heads
Bow their heads to the ground.

verses.text: My eyes fail with tears,My heart is troubled;My bile is poured on the groundBecause of the destruction of the daughter of my people,Because the children and the infantsFaint in the streets of the city.
parts: bile is poured on the ground
Because of the destruction of the daughter of my people,
Because the children and the infants
Faint in the streets of the city.

verses.text: They say to their mothers,“Where is grain and wine?”As they swoon like the woundedIn the streets of the city,As their life is poured outIn their mothers’ bosom.
parts: As they swoon like the wounded
In the streets of the city,
As their life is poured out

verses.text: How shall I console you?To what shall I liken you,O daughter of Jerusalem?What shall I compare with you, that I may comfort you,O virgin daughter of Zion?For your ruin is spread wide as the sea;Who can heal you?
parts: To what shall I liken you,
What shall I compare with you, that I may comfort you,

verses.text: Your prophets have seen for youFalse and deceptive visions;They have not uncovered your iniquity,To bring back your captives,But have envisioned for you false prophecies and delusions.
parts: Your prophets have seen for you
They have not uncovered your iniquity,
But have envisioned for you false prophecies and delusions.

verses.text: All who pass by clap their hands at you;They hiss and shake their headsAt the daughter of Jerusalem:“Is this the city that is called‘The perfection of beauty,The joy of the whole earth’?”
parts: They hiss and shake their heads
this the city that is called
The joy of the whole earth’?”

verses.text: All your enemies have opened their mouth against you;They hiss and gnash their teeth.They say, “We have swallowed her up!Surely this is the day we have waited for;We have found it, we have seen it!”
parts: All your enemies have opened their mouth against you;
the day we have waited for;

verses.text: The  has done what He purposed;He has fulfilled His wordWhich He commanded in days of old.He has thrown down and has not pitied,And He has caused an enemy to rejoice over you;He has exalted the horn of your adversaries.
parts: Which He commanded in days of old.
He has thrown down and has not pitied,
And He has caused an enemy to rejoice over you;

verses.text: Their heart cried out to the Lord,“O wall of the daughter of Zion,Let tears run down like a river day and night;Give yourself no relief;Give your eyes no rest.
parts: Their heart cried out to the Lord,
“O wall of the daughter of Zion,
Let tears run down like a river day and night;

verses.text: “Arise, cry out in the night,At the beginning of the watches;Pour out your heart like water before the face of the Lord.Lift your hands toward HimFor the life of your young children,Who faint from hunger at the head of every street.”
parts: At the beginning of the watches;
Pour out your heart like water before the face of the Lord.
For the life of your young children,
Who faint from hunger at the head of every street.”

verses.text: I am the man who has seen affliction by the rod of His wrath.
parts: has seen affliction by the rod of His wrath.

verses.text: He has led me and made me walkIn darkness and not in light.
parts: He has led me and made

verses.text: Surely He has turned His hand against meTime and time again throughout the day.
parts: Surely He has turned His hand against me
Time and time again throughout the day.

verses.text: He has aged my flesh and my skin,And broken my bones.
parts: He has aged my flesh and my skin,

verses.text: He has besieged meAnd surrounded me with bitterness and woe.
He has set me in dark placesLike the dead of long ago.
parts: He has set me in dark places
Like the dead of long ago.

verses.text: He has hedged me in so that I cannot get out;He has made my chain heavy.
parts: He has hedged me in so that I cannot get out;
He has made my chain heavy.

verses.text: Even when I cry and shout,He shuts out my prayer.
parts: Even when I cry and shout,

verses.text: He has blocked my ways with hewn stone;He has made my paths crooked.
parts: He has blocked my ways with hewn stone;
He has made my paths crooked.

verses.text: He has been to me a bear lying in wait,Like a lion in ambush.
parts: to me a bear lying in wait,

verses.text: He has turned aside my ways and torn me in pieces;He has made me desolate.
parts: He has turned aside my ways and torn me in pieces;

verses.text: He has bent His bowAnd set me up as a target for the arrow.
parts: And set me up as a target for the arrow.

verses.text: He has caused the arrows of His quiverTo pierce my loins.
I have become the ridicule of all my people—Their taunting song all the day.
parts: I have become the ridicule of all my people—
Their taunting song all the day.

verses.text: He has filled me with bitterness,He has made me drink wormwood.
parts: He has filled me with bitterness,
He has made me drink wormwood.

verses.text: He has also broken my teeth with gravel,And covered me with ashes.
parts: He has also broken my teeth with gravel,

verses.text: You have moved my soul far from peace;I have forgotten prosperity.
parts: You have moved my soul far from peace;

verses.text: And I said, “My strength and my hopeHave perished from the .”
parts: And I said, “My strength and my hope

verses.text: Remember my affliction and roaming,The wormwood and the gall.
My soul still remembersAnd sinks within me.
This I recall to my mind,Therefore I have hope.
parts: This I recall to my mind,

verses.text: Through the ’s mercies we are not consumed,Because His compassions fail not.
They are new every morning;Great is Your faithfulness.
“The  is my portion,” says my soul,“Therefore I hope in Him!”
The  is good to those who wait for Him,To the soul who seeks Him.
parts: good to those who wait for Him,

verses.text: It is good that one should hope and wait quietlyFor the salvation of the .
It is good for a man to bearThe yoke in his youth.
parts: good for a man to bear

verses.text: Let him sit alone and keep silent,Because God has laid it on him;
parts: Let him sit alone and keep silent,

verses.text: Let him put his mouth in the dust—There may yet be hope.
parts: Let him put his mouth in the dust—

verses.text: Let him give his cheek to the one who strikes him,And be full of reproach.
parts: cheek to the one who strikes him,

verses.text: For the Lord will not cast off forever.
parts: For the Lord will not cast off forever.

verses.text: Though He causes grief,Yet He will show compassionAccording to the multitude of His mercies.
parts: According to the multitude of His mercies.

verses.text: For He does not afflict willingly,Nor grieve the children of men.
parts: Nor grieve the children of men.

verses.text: To crush under one’s feetAll the prisoners of the earth,
parts: All the prisoners of the earth,

verses.text: To turn aside the justice due a manBefore the face of the Most High,
parts: Before the face of the Most High,

verses.text: Or subvert a man in his cause—The Lord does not approve.
parts: Or subvert a man in his cause—

verses.text: Who is he who speaks and it comes to pass,When the Lord has not commanded it?
parts: speaks and it comes to pass,

verses.text: Is it not from the mouth of the Most HighThat woe and well-being proceed?
parts: not from the mouth of the Most High

verses.text: Why should a living man complain,A man for the punishment of his sins?
parts: A man for the punishment of his sins?

verses.text: Let us search out and examine our ways,And turn back to the ;
parts: Let us search out and examine our ways,

verses.text: Let us lift our hearts and handsTo God in heaven.
parts: Let us lift our hearts and hands

verses.text: We have transgressed and rebelled;You have not pardoned.
You have covered Yourself with angerAnd pursued us;You have slain and not pitied.
You have covered Yourself with a cloud,That prayer should not pass through.
parts: You have covered Yourself with a cloud,
That prayer should not pass through.

verses.text: You have made us an offscouring and refuseIn the midst of the peoples.
parts: You have made us an offscouring and refuse
In the midst of the peoples.

verses.text: All our enemiesHave opened their mouths against us.
parts: Have opened their mouths against us.

verses.text: Fear and a snare have come upon us,Desolation and destruction.
parts: Fear and a snare have come upon us,

verses.text: My eyes overflow with rivers of waterFor the destruction of the daughter of my people.
parts: My eyes overflow with rivers of water
For the destruction of the daughter of my people.

verses.text: My eyes flow and do not cease,Without interruption,
parts: My eyes flow and do not cease,

verses.text: Till the  from heavenLooks down and sees.
My eyes bring suffering to my soulBecause of all the daughters of my city.
parts: My eyes bring suffering to my soul
Because of all the daughters of my city.

verses.text: My enemies without causeHunted me down like a bird.
parts: Hunted me down like a bird.

verses.text: They silenced my life in the pitAnd threw stones at me.
parts: silenced my life in the pit

verses.text: The waters flowed over my head;I said, “I am cut off!”
parts: The waters flowed over my head;

verses.text: I called on Your name, O ,From the lowest pit.
parts: I called on Your name, O

parts: From my sighing, from my cry for help.”

verses.text: You drew near on the day I called on You,And said, “Do not fear!”
parts: You drew near on the day I called on You,

verses.text: O Lord, You have pleaded the case for my soul;You have redeemed my life.
parts: O Lord, You have pleaded the case for my soul;

verses.text: O , You have seen how I am wronged;Judge my case.
You have seen all their vengeance,All their schemes against me.
parts: You have seen all their vengeance,

verses.text: You have heard their reproach, O ,All their schemes against me,
parts: You have heard their reproach, O

verses.text: The lips of my enemiesAnd their whispering against me all the day.

verses.text: Look at their sitting down and their rising up;I am their taunting song.
parts: Look at their sitting down and their rising up;

verses.text: Give them a veiled heart;Your curse be upon them!

verses.text: How the gold has become dim!How changed the fine gold!The stones of the sanctuary are scatteredAt the head of every street.
parts: How the gold has become dim!
The stones of the sanctuary are
At the head of every street.

verses.text: The precious sons of Zion,Valuable as fine gold,How they are regarded as clay pots,The work of the hands of the potter!
parts: The work of the hands of the potter!

verses.text: Even the jackals present their breastsTo nurse their young;But the daughter of my people is cruel,Like ostriches in the wilderness.
parts: Even the jackals present their breasts

verses.text: The tongue of the infant clingsTo the roof of its mouth for thirst;The young children ask for bread,But no one breaks it for them.
parts: The tongue of the infant clings
To the roof of its mouth for thirst;
The young children ask for bread,

verses.text: Those who ate delicaciesAre desolate in the streets;Those who were brought up in scarletEmbrace ash heaps.
parts: Those who were brought up in scarlet

verses.text: The punishment of the iniquity of the daughter of my peopleIs greater than the punishment of the sin of Sodom,Which was overthrown in a moment,With no hand to help her!
parts: The punishment of the iniquity of the daughter of my people
Is greater than the punishment of the sin of Sodom,
Which was overthrown in a moment,
With no hand to help her!

verses.text: Her Nazirites were brighter than snowAnd whiter than milk;They were more ruddy in body than rubies,Like sapphire in their appearance.
parts: They were more ruddy in body than rubies,

verses.text: Now their appearance is blacker than soot;They go unrecognized in the streets;Their skin clings to their bones,It has become as dry as wood.

verses.text: Those slain by the sword are better offThan those who die of hunger;For these pine away,Stricken for lack of the fruits of the field.
parts: slain by the sword are better off
of the fruits of the field.

verses.text: The hands of the compassionate womenHave cooked their own children;They became food for themIn the destruction of the daughter of my people.
parts: The hands of the compassionate women
In the destruction of the daughter of my people.

verses.text: The  has fulfilled His fury,He has poured out His fierce anger.He kindled a fire in Zion,And it has devoured its foundations.
parts: He has poured out His fierce anger.
He kindled a fire in Zion,
And it has devoured its foundations.

verses.text: The kings of the earth,And all inhabitants of the world,Would not have believedThat the adversary and the enemyCould enter the gates of Jerusalem—
parts: And all inhabitants of the world,
That the adversary and the enemy
Could enter the gates of Jerusalem—

verses.text: Because of the sins of her prophetsAnd the iniquities of her priests,Who shed in her midstThe blood of the just.
parts: Because of the sins of her prophets

verses.text: They wandered blind in the streets;They have defiled themselves with blood,So that no one would touch their garments.
parts: They wandered blind in the streets;
They have defiled themselves with blood,
So that no one would touch their garments.

verses.text: They cried out to them,“Go away, unclean!Go away, go away,Do not touch us!”When they fled and wandered,Those among the nations said,“They shall no longer dwell here.”
The face of the  scattered them;He no longer regards them.The people do not respect the priestsNor show favor to the elders.
parts: Nor show favor to the elders.

verses.text: Still our eyes failed us,Watching vainly for our help;In our watching we watchedFor a nation that could not save us.
They tracked our stepsSo that we could not walk in our streets.Our end was near;Our days were over,For our end had come.
parts: So that we could not walk in our streets.

verses.text: Our pursuers were swifterThan the eagles of the heavens.They pursued us on the mountainsAnd lay in wait for us in the wilderness.
parts: Than the eagles of the heavens.
They pursued us on the mountains
And lay in wait for us in the wilderness.

verses.text: The breath of our nostrils, the anointed of the ,Was caught in their pits,Of whom we said, “Under his shadowWe shall live among the nations.”
parts: The breath of our nostrils, the anointed of the
Of whom we said, “Under his shadow
We shall live among the nations.”

verses.text: Rejoice and be glad, O daughter of Edom,You who dwell in the land of Uz!The cup shall also pass over to youAnd you shall become drunk and make yourself naked.
parts: Rejoice and be glad, O daughter of Edom,
who dwell in the land of Uz!
The cup shall also pass over to you
And you shall become drunk and make yourself naked.

verses.text: The punishment of your iniquity is accomplished,O daughter of Zion;He will no longer send you into captivity.He will punish your iniquity,O daughter of Edom;He will uncover your sins!
parts: He will no longer send you into captivity.

verse_parts.text: How the gold has become dim!
The stones of the sanctuary are
At the head of every street.
The work of the hands of the potter!
Even the jackals present their breasts
The tongue of the infant clings
To the roof of its mouth for thirst;
The young children ask for bread,
Those who were brought up in scarlet
The punishment of the iniquity of the daughter of my people
Is greater than the punishment of the sin of Sodom,
Which was overthrown in a moment,
With no hand to help her!
They were more ruddy in body than rubies,
their appearance is blacker than soot;
They go unrecognized in the streets;
Their skin clings to their bones,
It has become as dry as wood.
slain by the sword are better off
of the fruits of the field.

Than the eagles of the heavens.

verses.text: Remember, O , what has come upon us;Look, and behold our reproach!
Our inheritance has been turned over to aliens,And our houses to foreigners.
parts: Our inheritance has been turned over to aliens,

verses.text: We have become orphans and waifs,Our mothers are like widows.
parts: We have become orphans and waifs,

verses.text: We pay for the water we drink,And our wood comes at a price.
parts: We pay for the water we drink,
And our wood comes at a price.

verses.text: They pursue at our heels;We labor and have no rest.
We have given our hand to the EgyptiansAnd the Assyrians, to be satisfied with bread.
parts: the Assyrians, to be satisfied with bread.

verses.text: Our fathers sinned and are no more,But we bear their iniquities.
Servants rule over us;There is none to deliver us from their hand.
We get our bread at the risk of our lives,Because of the sword in the wilderness.
parts: Because of the sword in the wilderness.

verses.text: Our skin is hot as an oven,Because of the fever of famine.
parts: Our skin is hot as an oven,
Because of the fever of famine.

verses.text: They ravished the women in Zion,The maidens in the cities of Judah.
parts: They ravished the women in Zion,
The maidens in the cities of Judah.

verses.text: Princes were hung up by their hands,And elders were not respected.
parts: Princes were hung up by their hands,

verses.text: Young men ground at the millstones;Boys staggered under loads of wood.
parts: Young men ground at the millstones;

verses.text: The elders have ceased gathering at the gate,And the young men from their music.
parts: And the young men from their music.

verses.text: The joy of our heart has ceased;Our dance has turned into mourning.
parts: The joy of our heart has ceased;
Our dance has turned into mourning.

verses.text: The crown has fallen from our head.Woe to us, for we have sinned!
parts: Woe to us, for we have sinned!

verses.text: Because of this our heart is faint;Because of these things our eyes grow dim;
parts: Because of this our heart is faint;

verses.text: Because of Mount Zion which is desolate,With foxes walking about on it.
parts: Because of Mount Zion which is desolate,
With foxes walking about on it.

verses.text: You, O , remain forever;Your throne from generation to generation.
parts: Your throne from generation to generation.

verses.text: Why do You forget us forever,And forsake us for so long a time?
parts: Why do You forget us forever,
forsake us for so long a time?

verses.text: Turn us back to You, O , and we will be restored;Renew our days as of old,
parts: Turn us back to You, O
Renew our days as of old,

verses.text: Unless You have utterly rejected us,And are very angry with us!
parts: Unless You have utterly rejected us,

content_parts.text: —Written during the three months following the destruction of Jerusalem (October, 587 BC) and before Jeremiah was taken captive to Egypt in December of the same year.
God's judgment of the people's sins and His unfathomable love and sorrow for Israel.
God's judgment of the people's sins and His unfathomable love and sorrow for Israel.
This is Jeremiah's personal testimonial and lament over the devastation of Jerusalem and the temple.
The prophet maintains there is still hope for repentance and restoration.
Consistent with his previous and later messages, here he instructs the suffering Jews not to despise God's punishment but to repent, confessing their sins and seeking forgiveness and deliverance.
—The destruction of Jerusalem has just occurred, and the people have been taken away as captives to Babylon.
God continually forewarned them about these specific events through Jeremiah and His other prophets.
The Lord had sent many prophecies about His punishment of those who would not keep His commandments.
Jeremiah witnessed the destruction and laments over the loss of the people, the temple, and the city.
